pullRequest.title: KOGITO-3254: SVG Processing to apply executed path color changes
pullRequest.bodyText:
jira related https://issues.redhat.com/browse/KOGITO-3254.
Addon that creates and endpoint that return the SVG painting the process execution path

beforeCommit.message: KOGITO-3254: SVG Processing to apply executed path color changes

afterCommit.message: KOGITO-3254: SVG Processing to apply executed path color changes

nodes.bodyText: either turn to draft PR or remove this already
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,83 @@
+<project xmlns="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0"
+  xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"
+  xsi:schemaLocation="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0 http://maven.apache.org/xsd/maven-4.0.0.xsd">
+  <modelVersion>4.0.0</modelVersion>
+  <parent>
+    <groupId>org.kie.kogito</groupId>
+    <artifactId>addons</artifactId>
+    <version>1.0.0-SNAPSHOT</version>
+  </parent>
+  <artifactId>svg-process-addon</artifactId>
+  <name>Kogito :: Add-Ons :: SVG Process Visualization</name>
+
+  <description>Process SVG visualization</description>
+
+  <dependencies>
+    <dependency>
+      <groupId>io.quarkus</groupId>
+      <artifactId>quarkus-vertx</artifactId>
+    </dependency>
+    <dependency>
+      <groupId>io.quarkus</groupId>
+      <artifactId>quarkus-resteasy-mutiny</artifactId>
+    </dependency>
+    <dependency>
+      <groupId>io.smallrye.reactive</groupId>
+      <artifactId>smallrye-mutiny-vertx-web-client</artifactId>
+    </dependency>
+    <!-- image -->
+    <dependency>
+      <groupId>org.kie</groupId>
+      <artifactId>jbpm-process-svg</artifactId>
+      <exclusions>
+        <exclusion>
+          <groupId>xml-apis</groupId>
+          <artifactId>xml-apis</artifactId>
+        </exclusion>
+      </exclusions>
+      <version>${version.org.kie7}</version>
+    </dependency>
+
+    <!-- test dependencies -->
+    <dependency>
+      <groupId>io.quarkus</groupId>
+      <artifactId>quarkus-junit5</artifactId>
+      <scope>test</scope>
+    </dependency>
+    <dependency>
+      <groupId>org.mockito</groupId>
+      <artifactId>mockito-junit-jupiter</artifactId>
+      <scope>test</scope>
+    </dependency>
+    <dependency>
+      <groupId>net.javacrumbs.json-unit</groupId>
+      <artifactId>json-unit-assertj</artifactId>
+      <scope>test</scope>
+    </dependency>
+    <dependency>
+      <groupId>io.rest-assured</groupId>
+      <artifactId>rest-assured</artifactId>
+      <scope>test</scope>
+    </dependency>
+
+  </dependencies>
+  <!-- just for DEV, TO BE REMOVED -->

nodes.bodyText: I would argue for ProcessSvgService naming, imo it improves readability - similarly to the HttpResponse class imported above. Though I can see legacy naming conventions dictated by SVGImageProcessort and similar ...
the field is named svgResourcesPath, but in method we're using different naming convention in getProcessSVGFromVertxFileSystem, it would be good to unify.
And below for the method getSvgFileUni
the method naming - it would be good to start with a verb - does transformSvgToShowExecutedPath work fine?
can we use constant for the http status code?

Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            Place here the Process SVG to used as source where draw the execution path.
          
          
            
            Place here the Process SVG to be used as source where to draw the execution path.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,2 @@
+Place here the Process SVG to used as source where draw the execution path.

nodes.bodyText: can we use the inferface here instead?

@nmirasch could you add another method to simply retrieve the SVG for a process, without annotation.
@Path("processes/{processId})

@nmirasch seems like you're doing multiple calls to the same service, passing different parameters, I think it would be better if you could simply have one method getProcessInstanceSVG which gives you the annotated one, so everything else is considered internals of the service, wdyt?
